name: Belleau Region
desc: Although much of Fontaine is covered by water, there are also mountains and forests. Mont Automnequi, which lies between the harbor and the Court of Fontaine, is one of its most iconic peaks. The Fontaine Research Institute used huge engineering devices to bore the Poisson Tunnel, thereby solving one of the biggest challenges facing the construction of the aquabus lines.

customize.text: The Steambird Special Edition I: The Terrestrial Sea, Origin of All Waters

<color=#ffd780>August 9, 2023</color>
Hello Travelers~ There are many mysterious things waiting to be discovered in the waters of Fontaine. Let's find out more!
Recently, a certain publication is very popular among adventurers who are about to leave for Fontaine. It is said to be the special edition of The Steambird. Let's discover what's new together!
The Steambird Special Edition VII: Lone Suzerain of Land and Sea Beneath the Roiling Waters

<color=#ffd780>August 15, 2023</color>
Hello, Travelers~ This Special Edition of The Steambird will introduce a new enemy lurking in the watery depths of Fontaine: the "Emperor of Fire and Iron."

<color=#ffd780>October 2, 2023</color>
Genshin Impact's Fontaine OST album "Fountain of Belleau" is out now! The album's four discs "Chanson of Justice and Impartiality," "Arioso of Belle Epoque," "Chapelloise of Trickling Springs," and "La bataille de Fontaine" feature 96 remarkable tracks composed by the HOYO-MiX team, each one an original composition for the region of Fontaine in Genshin Impact.
The songs featured on the Fontaine OST album were recorded by the London Symphony Orchestra with special guest folk musicians at Abbey Road Studios, Angel Studios, Air-Edel Recording Studios, and other recording studios respectively.
<color=#ff9999>Disk 1:</color>

customize.name: Emperor's Resolution
customize.desc:
The war hammer of the Emperor of Fire and Iron. The mighty crab has crushed countless foes with this giant claw. Be it clockwork meka, other Fontemer Aberrants, or hunters with ill-placed curiosity — all have yielded under its power.

Fontemer Aberrants are different from human beings in that the concepts of aristocracy or inheritance are entirely foreign to them. None of them are born superior. One that survives deadly predators and adversities is able to accumulate infinite power as it keeps hunting and feeding over centuries. Such a creature is often referred to as an overlord for the fear it inspires.

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 107
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is "Demain, des l'aube."

customize.name: Emperor of Fire and Iron
customize.desc:
One of the two sovereigns who once stood at the apex of the aberrant species of the Fontemer, and the subject of many a tale among sailors.

An Armored Crab that avoids predation, and can keep hunting and eating, will continue to grow, continually seeking out suitable shells to become its new armor. But eventually, it became simply too gargantuan. Before the first diluvian period, a massive Armored Crab once attacked a ship, and was finally forced back into the depths by Basil Elton, who had not yet been reinstated as a naval commander.

Imagine this world: All of humanity has been purged from Teyvat, and the ever-growing Emperor of Fire and Iron eventually wears the Palais Mermonia upon its body like a luxurious coat of white stone. Of course, in such a world, there naturally would be no one to call it, half-jokingly and half in awe, the "Emperor of Fire and Iron."

customize.name: Hinterman
customize.desc: A fishmonger living in Poisson. He offers a variety of ingredients and local specialties.

customize.name: Melus
customize.desc: Spina di Rosula's butler. He died during the evacuation of Poisson.

customize.name: Silver
customize.desc: Navia Caspar's attendant. He died during the evacuation of Poisson.

customize.name: Florent
customize.desc: Spina di Rosula's senior advisor.

customize.name: Coralie
customize.desc: A wife of the former Spina di Rosula's informant, Jacques.

customize.name: Hermosa
customize.desc: A photographer who claims to be an adventurer instead. Many of her photos have either been published in newspapers or used as illustrations in books, with each one featuring her beloved cat.

customize.name: Everallin
customize.desc: A Melusine who is part of the Maison Gardiennage. Due to her extraordinary talent of sensing changes in the ocean's movements, she has been stationed in Romaritime Harbor to help observe the ocean and report of any oncoming storms or showers.

customize.name: Henri
customize.desc: A man who was tricked into destroying the Research Institute's devices by a Fatuus.

customize.text: Romaritime Harbor is a coastal observation deck on the south of the Belleau Region. The harbor includes two levels allowing ships from Sumeru and Fontaine to moor there. It is built on the side of a waterfall vista and is a stopping point of the aquabus. From here, the aquabus can take you to the Court of Fontaine on Clementine Line. Romaritime Harbor borders Sumeru, so many tourists, merchants, and even lovers of books from the land of deserts and rainforests come there.

The thunderous noise of the waterfall drowns out the sound of people coming and going into the harbor below. Even if you use the elevator, it still takes a considerable amount of time to reach the top of the waterfall. But once you're on the Clementine Line and heading towards the heart of the nation of Hydro, all the time you've waited pales into insignificance.
A Melusine Everallin works in the harbor, and her job is to observe the sea and track the ocean's movements. She also warns people about storms and showers ahead of time.
Several Genius Invocation TCG duelists can be found in Romaritime Harbor: Everallin and Lectoure on the lower platform, and Hermosa and Rena on the upper platform.

North of the harbor, there are old ruins. Legends say that the first Lochknight, one of the Mistress of Many Waters' followers, concealed themselves in the remote wilderness with Lochfolk, intending to use self-exile and rigorous training in an attempt to repay a sin fated to be beyond redemption. Now the land has long returned to deathly silence, with the long, chill winds still blowing through the deserted valley.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Court of Fontaine Region
customize.desc:
"This city alone stands above all waters."

Towering up at the highest point of the city, the Palais Mermonia represents the highest authority in Fontaine. Under its gaze, the people lead orderly lives that are as regular and predictable as the aquabus.

Law serves to maintain a stable order, which is in turn the cornerstone that equity and justice are built upon.

customize.name: Lochknights
customize.desc: Lochknights are followers of the Mistress of Many Waters, Egeria, who swore to protect the Oceanids, find the Pure Grail, and shatter the shackles that confined Egeria to atone for the original sin.

customize.name: Oceanids
customize.desc: Oceanids are intelligent Hydro lifeforms created by the previous Hydro Archon, Egeria, and are able to manipulate water at will. All the people of Fontaine were once Oceanids, whom Egeria had turned into humans to satisfy their wishes, going against the will of the Heavenly Principles.

customize.name: Everallin
customize.desc: A Melusine who is part of the Maison Gardiennage. Due to her extraordinary talent of sensing changes in the ocean's movements, she has been stationed in Romaritime Harbor to help observe the ocean and report of any oncoming storms or showers.

customize.name: Hermosa
customize.desc: A photographer who claims to be an adventurer instead. Many of her photos have either been published in newspapers or used as illustrations in books, with each one featuring her beloved cat.

customize.text:
Poisson is a quiet town at the foot of Mont Automnequi. Its residents mostly work in the fishing or underwater salvage industries. Legends say that before the first diluvian period, the town was once a central hub for Fontaine's maritime traffic network. Although the change in water levels resulted in the loss of the town's status as a major port, the cozy and warm vibe of the town doubtlessly still attracts many visitors. A fishmonger Hinterman can be found in Poisson.
Poisson is home to Spina di Rosula, an organization that helps people solve complex issues. The organization's headquarters is located within a huge ship inside the town. The town was significantly damaged during the disaster, but, thanks to Spina di Rosula and its current head, Navia Caspar, it was rebuilt.
In the north of Poisson, the quests

customize.name: Spina di Rosula
customize.desc: Spina di Rosula is a citizen-oriented society that involves many walks of life and focuses its efforts on solving difficult issues amongst the common folk, and that it will cooperate with the Fontainian authorities where needed.

customize.name: Navia
customize.desc: The current President of Spina di Rosula, who is lovely, dutiful, and a great boss.

customize.name: Hinterman
customize.desc: A fishmonger living in Poisson. He offers a variety of ingredients and local specialties.

customize.text: Though much of Fontaine is covered by water, there are also mountains and forests. Mont Automnequi, which lies between the harbor and the Court of Fontaine, is one of its most iconic peaks. The Fontaine Research Institute used huge engineering devices to dig the Poisson Tunnel, thereby solving one of the biggest challenges facing the construction of the aquabus lines.

From Mont Automnequi, one can see the ridge of Elynas, beneath which the homeland of the Melusines is hidden. Salsa, an artist who stands against the Adventurers' Guild, once painted the scenery here.

In the west of Mont Automnequi, there is a small village where the famous writer from Fontaine, Baptiste, author of "The Two Musketeers," lived. The novel centers around two illegitimate children born to a baron's maid, who endured mistreatment in the baron's household. After their mother was killed, they fled home but vowed to avenge her. The brother and sister became experienced musketeers and, years later, began to take revenge on members of the baron's family to uncover the truth about their mother's death and restore justice. During the Fontinalia Film Festival, this novel became the basis of a film produced by Xavier and directed by Furina. The same book became the inspiration for a series of murders investigated by Chevreuse, the captain of the Special Security and Surveillance Patrol. As in the book, the killer left a rainbow rose at the crime scene, and these roses led Chevreuse, with the help of perfumer Emilie, to the killer. The flowers were from a rare cultivar that grew precisely in the Baptiste's garden in a village on the west slopes of Mont Automneqi. Chevreuse's investigation revealed that Baptiste wrote "The Two Musketeers" based on real events from his life: his mother, Elisa, was murdered as a result of an affair with a member of a wealthy family, leaving Baptiste and his sister, Veronica alone. Veronica decided to take revenge on her father. Her first victim was the assassin sent to kill her mother. Although Baptiste, Veronica, and their father were sent to the Fortress of Meropide, Chevreuse asked the Duke of the Fortress, Wriothesley, to tell the prisoners about the siblings' difficult past and the actions of their father.

On the south of the area, there's an underwater cave with the massive Armored Crab's lair. People called it the "Emperor of Fire and Iron." It's one of the two sovereigns who once stood at the apex of the aberrant species of the Fontemer, and the subject of many a tale among sailors. Fontemer Aberrants are different from human beings in that the concepts of aristocracy or inheritance are entirely foreign to them. None of them are born superior. One that survives deadly predators and adversities can accumulate infinite power as it keeps hunting and feeding over centuries. Such a creature is often referred to as an overlord for the fear it inspires. Before the first diluvian period, a massive Armored Crab once attacked a ship and was finally forced back into the depths by a famous ex-Admiral of White Armada, Basil Elton, who had not yet been reinstated as a naval commander.

In addition, on the southern coast of Mont Automnequi there are ancient ruins with carved murals depicting the creation of the Oceanids by the Mistress of Many Waters, Egeria, the commission of original sin, and the prophecy of Fontaine.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Beryl Region
customize.desc:
An ancient ruin-studded mountain range across the water from the Court of Fontaine.

Many, many centuries ago, the followers of Egeria once saw this place as a prime location for excursions and picnics. Gathered here, they sang of love and dreams as pure and stainless as polished gems. Their songs have long faded into the pale moonlight, and now, only cool breezes continue to caress these lonely, mint-studded highlands.

customize.name: Fontinalia Festival
customize.desc: The Fontinalia Festival was created to commemorate the Lochknights' search for the Oceanids and their welcoming of the previous Hydro Archon Egeria.

customize.name: Fontaine Research Institute
customize.desc: The Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering was founded by Alain Guillotin and is often shortened to simply the Fontaine Research Institute.

customize.name: Melusines
customize.desc: Melusines are an all-female species born from the wounds of Elynas after he was injured from an explosion that took place within his petrified body. They once resided exclusively in Merusea Village, but after meeting the newly appointed Iudex Neuvillette, many can now be found on the surface of Fontaine as part of the Marechaussee Phantom.

customize.name: Oceanids
customize.desc: Oceanids are intelligent Hydro lifeforms created by the previous Hydro Archon, Egeria, and are able to manipulate water at will. All the people of Fontaine were once Oceanids, whom Egeria had turned into humans to satisfy their wishes, going against the will of the Heavenly Principles.

customize.name: Salsa
customize.desc: An artist and founder of the "Alliance of Artists to Overthrow the Evil Organization and Protect the Future of Fontaine."

customize.name: Chevreuse
customize.desc: The captain of the Special Security and Surveillance Patrol, who wears justice as an ever-present seal upon her heart. Her musket shall only ever point at the guilty.

customize.name: Wriothesley
customize.desc: Duke of the Fortress of Meropide, Lord Incognito of the murky depths.

customize.name: Furina
customize.desc: The absolute focus of the stage of judgment, until the final applause sounds.

customize.name: Xavier
customize.desc: He is a member of the Daydream Club, a group of inventors from Fontaine, the inventor of the Film Kamera, and the founder of a film company, "Musketeer Pictures."

customize.name: Egeria
customize.desc: The previous Hydro Archon who died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.name: Basil Elton
customize.desc: Basil was a retired admiral of the Fontaine Armada, Captain of the Sponsian, and Vice Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute. She died 500 years ago during the Cataclysm.

customize.name: Emperor of Fire and Iron
customize.desc:
One of the two sovereigns who once stood at the apex of the aberrant species of the Fontemer, and the subject of many a tale among sailors.

An Armored Crab that avoids predation, and can keep hunting and eating, will continue to grow, continually seeking out suitable shells to become its new armor. But eventually, it became simply too gargantuan. Before the first diluvian period, a massive Armored Crab once attacked a ship, and was finally forced back into the depths by Basil Elton, who had not yet been reinstated as a naval commander.

Imagine this world: All of humanity has been purged from Teyvat, and the ever-growing Emperor of Fire and Iron eventually wears the Palais Mermonia upon its body like a luxurious coat of white stone. Of course, in such a world, there naturally would be no one to call it, half-jokingly and half in awe, the "Emperor of Fire and Iron."

customize.desc:
The war hammer of the Emperor of Fire and Iron. The mighty crab has crushed countless foes with this giant claw. Be it clockwork meka, other Fontemer Aberrants, or hunters with ill-placed curiosity — all have yielded under its power.

Fontemer Aberrants are different from human beings in that the concepts of aristocracy or inheritance are entirely foreign to them. None of them are born superior. One that survives deadly predators and adversities is able to accumulate infinite power as it keeps hunting and feeding over centuries. Such a creature is often referred to as an overlord for the fear it inspires.

customize.name: Rainbow Rose
customize.desc: A delicate and tender pink flower. Despite their name, Rainbow Roses are essentially more akin to Lilies.

customize.text:
Once, the authorities of Fontaine wanted to create an undercity beneath the city, the Fleuve Cendre, from the sewers under the Court of Fontaine. Since it was difficult to maintain order, Eduardo Baker and his friends seized power in the Fleuve Cendre. They began to resolve disputes between Fleuve Cendre "compatriots," bless the newly wedded, and protect the merchants from being extorted, harassed, and blackmailed by the gangs. When the authorities of the Court of Fontaine decided to purge the Fleuve Cendre, Baker was arrested and exiled to the desert. On the way to exile, he, with the help of his henchmen, fled to Poisson, taking hostage both the city itself and the members of the Maison Gardiennage who were transporting Baker. He made several unreasonable demands, so the Marechaussee Hunters, under the direction of Emanuel Guillotin, intervened. Journalist Karl Ingold arrived in Poisson as a negotiator along with Eduardo's son, Jakob.
Following an unsuccessful attempt to resolve the issue, the disagreement between Baker's group and the Marechaussee Hunters turned into a violent fight. As a result, Jakob and Rene, the Poisson Mayor's son, were left orphans. They were both sent to the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage that often housed the children of criminals. Later, these two children founded The Narzissenkreuz Ordo, one of the most important organizations in Fontaine's History. The Siege of Poisson left physical and mental scars on Guillotin. Due to this event, he left the ranks of the Marechaussee and planned to live out the rest of his days, content with just the contents of his cup.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Marechaussee Phantom
customize.desc: The personal unit of the Chief Justice Neuvillette, which is responsible for crime investigation. It is based in the Palais Mermonia and is one of the Maison Gardiennage's departments.

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Institute
customize.desc: A Fontaine orphanage, built on the ruins of the ancient civilization.

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo
customize.desc: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo is the secret society formed by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold to create Neohumans in order to survive against the destruction of the world as foretold by the world-formula. It was declared an illegal extremist group and a criminal organization by Fontainian law under Iudex Neuvillette.

customize.name: Jakob
customize.desc: An orphan raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute and later adopted by Karl Ingold. He became a Neohuman and the co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

customize.name: Narzissenkreuz
customize.desc: The leader of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, formerly known as Rene de Petrichor.

customize.name: Fleuve Cendre Ferryman
customize.desc: A handy length of abandoned copper pipe that was once used as a weapon. It was famous — or infamous, depending — in some circles.

customize.text:
Spina di Rosula is a citizen-oriented society that involves many walks of life and focuses its efforts on solving difficult issues amongst the common folk, and it will cooperate with the Fontainian authorities where needed. The organization, which headquarters is located within the ship, was founded by Callas in Poisson. A gigantic and glamorous ship embodies discovery, opportunity, ambition, and conquest. It symbolizes Spina di Rosula's bright and limitless future. The Spina's emblem, featuring an anchor and roses, was designed by Clementine, Callas's wife and Navia's mother, the current head of the organization.
One of Callas's most important projects was the construction of aquabus water lines stretching throughout Fontaine. When the construction of the lines was discussed, Spina di Rosula was divided into two parties. Callas believed that the organization had a rare opportunity to establish cooperation with the authorities of the Court of Fontaine and the Research Institute and that the construction of the lines would help to establish useful connections. The aquabuses were supposed to bring commercial benefits and a good reputation among the residents of Fontaine. The second party, led by a Spina di Rosula member Romeuf, thought that such significant sums would be better invested in the development of Poisson. When the parties could not agree, Romeuf and his supporters harbored a grudge against Callas and Clementine, considering her biased because of her pregnancy. For Romeuf's group, Clementine's support for the construction of the lines was a betrayal, meaning their voices would never be heard again. After Clementine died due to complications during the birth of her daughter, Callas began to view the construction of lines as the embodiment of her last will. Then the last hope of compromise disappeared, so Romeuf left Spina di Rosula.

As a result, with the support of Spina di Rosula, three aquabus's lines were built, named after the Caspar family: Clementine, Navia, and Callas. Although the organization's home is Poisson, none of the lines lead into the town, and only the Clementine line passes through the Mont Automnequi. The Callas line leading from the Court of Fontaine to the Research Institute was destroyed when the Institute's Central Laboratory exploded.
Many years later, when the daughter of Clementine and Callas, Navia, became the president of the organization, Romeuf decided to take revenge on Spina di Rosula and blow up the Clementine line passing over Poisson. His assistant Colter, who had recently left the Fortress of Meropide, blamed all the troubles that happened to Spina di Rosula on Navia, because of whom, in his opinion, Clementine, Callas, and the former butler Melus died. He believed that Navia destroyed everything dear to him with her own hands and brought Poisson to destruction. Navia was able to defeat Colter in a fight, and the Traveler and Paimon defused the bombs and saved the line from destruction.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Spina di Rosula
customize.desc: Spina di Rosula is a citizen-oriented society that involves many walks of life and focuses its efforts on solving difficult issues amongst the common folk, and that it will cooperate with the Fontainian authorities where needed.

customize.name: Fontaine Research Institute
customize.desc: The Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering was founded by Alain Guillotin and is often shortened to simply the Fontaine Research Institute.

customize.name: Navia
customize.desc: The current President of Spina di Rosula, who is lovely, dutiful, and a great boss.

customize.text:
Several millennia ago, Egeria, the previous Hydro Archon, sinned using the power of the Primordial Sea to turn the Oceanids into humans. So, a prophecy appeared in Fontaine, which read: <color=#ffffffd9>"In the end, the people will all be dissolved into the waters, and only the Hydro Archon will remain, weeping on her throne."</color>
Many years later, the prophecy began to come true, and an outburst of water from the Primordial Sea occurred near Poisson. Residents of Poisson did not immediately recognize the danger, so passers-by who found themselves near the water immediately disappeared. After this, people began to run in panic, hoping to reach higher places. Some people were injured during the stampede or fell from heights. When a rescue operation was organized, many were saved, but Melus and Silver, Navia's assistants who helped with the evacuation, did not manage to leave in time. The head of Spina di Rosula Navia, with the support of the Fatui Harbinger Arlecchino, was able to ensure the safety of the affected residents of Poisson, evacuating them from the town.
The people of Poisson blamed Hydro Archon Furina for the disaster, as they believed that she did nothing to save them. After the incident, the town gradually began to recover, and Navia promised compensation to all victims. Although the financial situation of the Spina is far from desired, this promise helped express the attitude towards what had happened so that people would again believe in the organization.

After Poisson was rebuilt, the residents decided to build a monument of Navia's parents. People wanted to show their gratitude to Clementine and Callas for the development of Poisson and Spina di Rosula, so they donated funds to build the memorial. Although Navia felt that she had not done enough to be present at the monument, the people of Poisson were grateful to her for everything she had done recently and included her in the model.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Egeria
customize.desc: The previous Hydro Archon who died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.name: Focalors
customize.desc: The last Hydro Archon and the God of Justice. She sacrificed herself in order to destroy the Hydro Archon's Divine Throne and restore power to the Hydro Dragon.

customize.name: Furina
customize.desc: The absolute focus of the stage of judgment, until the final applause sounds.

customize.name: Navia
customize.desc: The current President of Spina di Rosula, who is lovely, dutiful, and a great boss.

customize.name: Arlecchino
customize.desc: "The Knave," Fourth of the Fatui Harbingers. A poised, ruthless diplomat. To the children in the House of the Hearth, she is their feared yet dependable "Father."

customize.name: Melus
customize.desc: Spina di Rosula's butler. He died during the evacuation of Poisson.

customize.name: Silver
customize.desc: Navia Caspar's attendant. He died during the evacuation of Poisson.

imgDesc.text:
Where the Spina di Rosula was born. Just as a tiny chick that will one day become a soaring eagle is hatched from an egg, so are grand and radiant ambitions hatched in a dark and cramped place.
The people of Poisson are like the residents of the Fleuve Cendre, and from the history of these places they understand that some things are worth being, and indeed must be, fought for and bought by blood.

Salsa once painted the scenery here.
From Mont Automnequi, one can see the ridge of Elynas. Beneath the peaks and lakes, the homeland of the Melusines is hidden.

Justice reveals the truth. Evil shall be punished, good shall be rewarded. You and I are but drops of water within the sourcewater, our original wishes carried into the depths on the rapid currents, buried alongside forgotten notes and codes.
